title: E field of distribution - three rings R 2R 100R

content.question: Three charged rings of different radii are concentric with one another, as shown in the figure. The rings have radii <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, <math alttext="2 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>, and <math alttext="100 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mi>R</mi></math>, and all three rings have the same uniform charge density <math alttext="lambda" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>λ</mi></math>. Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> is on the common axis of the rings, a distance of <math alttext="10 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mi>R</mi></math> from the rings’ center. Which of the following correctly ranks the magnitudes of the electric field contributions <math alttext="E sub uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="E sub 2 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>, and <math alttext="E sub 100 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>100</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math> from the three rings at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="E sub uppercase R is greater than E sub 2 uppercase R, which is greater than E sub 100 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>100</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub 2 uppercase R is greater than E sub uppercase R, which is greater than E sub 100 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>100</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub 100 uppercase R is greater than E sub uppercase R, which is greater than E sub 2 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>100</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub 100 uppercase R is greater than E sub 2 uppercase R, which is greater than E sub uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>100</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="E sub 2 uppercase R is greater than E sub uppercase R, which is greater than E sub 100 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>100</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
